title: Video: Water pours into South Station from newly renovated ceiling
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A maintenance worker accidentally damaged a pressurized sprinkler line at South Station, causing water to pour into the concourse.
The incident occurred at the newly renovated area below the South Station Tower, developed by Hines Development.
MBTA confirmed no train services were disrupted, and cleanup procedures are currently underway at the site.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Take the Boston.com news quiz to test your knowledge of Greater Boston's latest stories.
Peter Chianca has been Boston.com's general assignment editor since 2019.
Chianca has a background as a news editor, columnist, and music writer in Greater Boston.

title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA has canceled all Feb. 13 Hingham/Hull ferry services due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will replace ferry service, operating from Nantasket Beach to Hull Ferry Terminal starting at 6:30 a.m.
Recent winter storm causing thick ice has led to unusual ferry cancellations in Boston Harbor this season.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Retired Gloucester firefighter Daniel Kennedy died after being hit by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell.
Kennedy, 60, was hospitalized after the crash on Wilder Street and died the following Wednesday at Lahey Hospital.
An investigation is ongoing involving the Middlesex District Attorney, State Police, and MSP Crash Analysis and Reconstruction Section.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas may start in Triple-A Worcester in 2026 due to injuries and competition at first base and DH.
Kristian Campbell likely returns to Triple-A Worcester with defensive struggles and stiff competition for the DH spot.
Pitchers Payton Tolle and Connelly Early may miss the 2026 Opening Day roster due to a packed starting rotation.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: State documents confirm plans for a new ICE facility at 50 Robert Milligan Parkway, Merrimack, NH, known by officials since Jan. 12.
Commissioner Sarah Stewart resigned after Governor Kelly Ayotte's administration investigated the failure to inform about the ICE facility plans.
The ICE Merrimack facility, costing $158 million to renovate, is projected to hold 400-600 beds by Fiscal Year 2026.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Will Campbell remains at left tackle despite struggles, as confirmed by coach Mike Vrabel.
Dante Scarnecchia supports Campbell, citing his strong rookie performance before a knee injury affected play.
Former Pro Bowl tackle Terron Armstead offers offseason training to help Campbell improve blocking technique.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel consoled Patriots players after their 29-13 Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks.
Vrabel emphasized unity and future prospects, encouraging players to remain focused on upcoming seasons and potential improvements.
In his first year as head coach, Vrabel led the Patriots to a 14-win season and an AFC East title.

title: Patriots reportedly make changes to coaching staff, move Williams to ‘high-ranking’ role
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots have moved Terrell Williams to a senior role, opening the defensive coordinator position for 2026.
Zak Kuhr is the frontrunner to become the full-time defensive coordinator after leading the defense to a fourth-place ranking.
Terrell Williams, now cancer-free, returned to the team after a leave of absence for health reasons last year.

title: Pittsfield man, 69, killed in hit-and-run crash that dragged him ‘lengthy distance,’ DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Colbert, 69, was killed in a hit-and-run in Pittsfield, dragged under a car for a lengthy distance.
The dark-colored sedan involved fled the scene near Linden Street and Francis Avenue, and is currently sought by police.
Authorities request public assistance via email or phone if surveillance video or information about the incident is available.
